title: Doppler - wavefront diagrams - 2 objects in water

content.question: Objects <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> are on the surface of a tank of water and oscillate upward and downward with the same rest frequency. The figure shows a top view of the objects moving in different directions across the surface of the water as they oscillate vertically, creating the wavefronts shown. Each circular wavefront was created at the instant the corresponding object was located at the center of the wavefront, and the wavefronts at Point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> are farther apart than the wavefronts at Point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>. Relative to the water, the edges of the wavefronts move with speed <math alttext="v sub W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub></math> while objects <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> and <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> move with speeds <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> and <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, respectively. Which of the following correctly compares <math alttext="v sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="v sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="v sub W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="v sub 1, end sub, is greater than, v sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, v sub W, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub 2, end sub, is greater than, v sub 1, end sub, which is greater than, v sub W, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub W, end sub, is greater than, v sub 1, end sub, which is greater than, v sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="v sub W, end sub, is greater than, v sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, v sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="v sub W, end sub, is greater than, v sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, v sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>v</mi><mi>W</mi></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>v</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
